parameters.name: path
parameters.description: This path variable may contain slashes '/' and may be empty.

get.summary: Returns the contents of a file on the server's filesystem.
get.description: Content-Type is determined by the suffix of the file.
Get all app configs. This operation is only allowed for admin users.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Start with app config number equal to offset. Default is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of app config to fetch. Default is 20.

post.description: Create app config. The field [uuid] MUST BE unique for each application. Use a OS-spesific device id or a [universally unique identifier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier).

get.description: Get app config. A configuration is unique for each application regardless of which user is logged in.

patch.description: Update app config. Only fields in request are updated. Existing values WILL BE overwritten, others remain unchanged.

requestBody.description: Update AppConfig. Only fields in request are updated.

commander.description: Passcode for access with Commander rights

personnel.description: Passcode for access with Personnel rights

PassCodes.description: Pass codes for access rights to spesific Incident instance

Coordinates.description: GeoJSON coordinate. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

items.description: GeoJSON coordinate. There MUST be two or more elements. The first two elements are longitude and latitude, or easting and northing, precisely in that order and using decimal numbers. Altitude or elevation MAY be included as an optional third element.

Circle.description: Circle feature described by a GeoJSON point in center and a radius as an property

Rectangle.description: Rectangle feature described by two GeoJSON points forming upper left and lower right corners

timestamp.description: Timestamp in ISO8601 Date Time String Format

Position.description: Position feature described by a GeoJSON point with accuracy, point type and timestamp

demo.description: Use demo-mode (no real data and any login)

demoRole.description: Role of logged in user in demo-mode

locationWhenInUse.description: Location access when app is in use is granted

mapCacheTTL.description: Number of days downloaded map tiles are cached locally

mapCacheCapacity.description: Maximum number map tiles cached locally

locationFastestInterval.description: Fastest interval between location updates in milliseconds

locationSmallestDisplacement.description: Smallest displacment in meters before update is received

keepScreenOn.description: Keep screen on when maps are displayed

sentryDns.description: Sentry DNS for remote error reporting

clues.description: List of Clues for planning and response

subjects.description: List of uuids of Subjects impacted by this Incident

operations.description: List of uuids of Operations responding to this Incident

uuid.description: Incident uuid which this operation responds to

talkgroups.description: List of talk gropus in use

missions.description: List of uuid of Missions executed by this operation

units.description: List of uuid of Units mobilized for this operation

personnels.description: List of uuid of Personnels mobilized for this operation

lines.description: Pass codes for authorizing access to Operation data

parts.description: Points, linestrings, rectangles and circles describing mission parts

results.description: Points, linestrings, rectangles and circles describing the results

assignedTo.description: Uuid of unit assigned to mission

id.description: Mission part id (unique in Mission only)
Mission result id (unique in Mission only)

personnels.description: List of uuid of Unit assigned to this unit

201.description: Created. The POST-ed resource was created.

204.description: No Content. The resource was updated.

400.description: Bad request. Request contains wrong or is missing required data

401.description: Unauthorized. The client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.

403.description: Forbidden. The client does not have access rights to the content.

404.description: Not found. The requested resource does not exist in server.

405.description: Method Not Allowed. The request method is known by the server but has been disabled and cannot be used.

409.description: Conflict. This response is sent when a request conflicts with the current state of the server.

503.description: Service unavailable. The server is not ready to handle the request. Common causes are a server that is down for maintenance or that is overloaded.

InsufficientScope.description: The provided credentials or bearer token have insufficient permission to access this route.

scope.description: The required scope for this operation.

InsufficientAccess.description: The provided credentials or bearer token are not authorized for this request.

MalformedAuthorizationHeader.description: The provided Authorization header was malformed.

id.discoos.org.description: This endpoint requires an identity token issed from https://id.discoos.io passed as a [Bearer token](https://swagger.io/docs/specification/authentication/bearer-authentication/) issued by in an [Authorization header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Authorization).

Passcode.description: Authenticed users with an admin role is granted access to all objects and all available fields in each of these objects regardless of any affiliation or 'X-Passcode' given. All other roles are only granted access to objects if 'X-Passcode' is valid. Requests without header 'X-Passcode' or an invalid passcode will receive response `403 Forbidden`. Brute-force attacks are banned for a lmitied time without any feedback. When banned, all request will receive response `403 Forbidden` regardless of the value in 'X-Passcode'.
Passcode.name: X-Passcode
